speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: SCENE III. The British camp near Dover.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter, in conquest, with drum and colours, EDMUND,  KING LEAR and CORDELIA, prisoners; Captain, Soldiers,  and c

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Some officers take them away: good guard,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Until their greater pleasures first be known

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That are to censure them.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: We are not the first

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Who, with best meaning, have incurr'd the worst.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: For thee, oppressed king, am I cast down;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Myself could else out-frown false fortune's frown.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, no, no, no! Come, let's away to prison:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: We two alone will sing like birds i' the cage:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When thou dost ask me blessing, I'll kneel down,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And ask of thee forgiveness: so we'll live,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And pray, and sing, and tell old tales, and laugh

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: At gilded butterflies, and hear poor rogues

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Talk of court news; and we'll talk with them too,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who loses and who wins; who's in, who's out;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And take upon's the mystery of things,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: As if we were God's spies: and we'll wear out,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In a wall'd prison, packs and sects of great ones,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That ebb and flow by the moon.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Take them away.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Upon such sacrifices, my Cordelia,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The gods themselves throw incense. Have I caught thee?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: He that parts us shall bring a brand from heaven,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And fire us hence like foxes. Wipe thine eyes;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The good-years shall devour them, flesh and fell,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ere they shall make us weep: we'll see 'em starve

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: first. Come.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt KING LEAR and CORDELIA, guarded

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Come hither, captain; hark.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Take thou this note;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Giving a paper

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: go follow them to prison:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: One step I have advanced thee; if thou dost

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: As this instructs thee, thou dost make thy way

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To noble fortunes: know thou this, that men

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Are as the time is: to be tender-minded

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Does not become a sword: thy great employment

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Will not bear question; either say thou'lt do 't,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Or thrive by other means.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: I'll do 't, my lord.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: About it; and write happy when thou hast done.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Mark, I say, instantly; and carry it so

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: As I have set it down.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: I cannot draw a cart, nor eat dried oats;

speaker: Captain
text_entry: If it be man's work, I'll do 't.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Flourish. Enter ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN, another Captain, and Soldiers

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Sir, you have shown to-day your valiant strain,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: And fortune led you well: you have the captives

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: That were the opposites of this day's strife:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: We do require them of you, so to use them

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: As we shall find their merits and our safety

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: May equally determine.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Sir, I thought it fit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To send the old and miserable king

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To some retention and appointed guard;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Whose age has charms in it, whose title more,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To pluck the common bosom on his side,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: An turn our impress'd lances in our eyes

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Which do command them. With him I sent the queen;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My reason all the same; and they are ready

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To-morrow, or at further space, to appear

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Where you shall hold your session. At this time

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: We sweat and bleed: the friend hath lost his friend;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And the best quarrels, in the heat, are cursed

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: By those that feel their sharpness:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The question of Cordelia and her father

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Requires a fitter place.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Sir, by your patience,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: I hold you but a subject of this war,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Not as a brother.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: That's as we list to grace him.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Methinks our pleasure might have been demanded,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Ere you had spoke so far. He led our powers;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Bore the commission of my place and person;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: The which immediacy may well stand up,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And call itself your brother.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not so hot:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: In his own grace he doth exalt himself,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: More than in your addition.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: In my rights,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: By me invested, he compeers the best.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That were the most, if he should husband you.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Jesters do oft prove prophets.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Holla, holla!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That eye that told you so look'd but a-squint.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Lady, I am not well; else I should answer

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: From a full-flowing stomach. General,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Take thou my soldiers, prisoners, patrimony;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Dispose of them, of me; the walls are thine:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Witness the world, that I create thee here

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: My lord and master.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Mean you to enjoy him?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The let-alone lies not in your good will.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Nor in thine, lord.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Half-blooded fellow, yes.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: [To EDMUND]  Let the drum strike, and prove my title thine.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Stay yet; hear reason. Edmund, I arrest thee

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: On capital treason; and, in thine attaint,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: This gilded serpent

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Pointing to Goneril

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: For your claim, fair sister,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: I bar it in the interest of my wife:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: 'Tis she is sub-contracted to this lord,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: And I, her husband, contradict your bans.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: If you will marry, make your loves to me,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: My lady is bespoke.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: An interlude!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Thou art arm'd, Gloucester: let the trumpet sound:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: If none appear to prove upon thy head

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Thy heinous, manifest, and many treasons,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: There is my pledge;

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Throwing down a glove

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: I'll prove it on thy heart,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Ere I taste bread, thou art in nothing less

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Than I have here proclaim'd thee.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Sick, O, sick!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: [Aside]  If not, I'll ne'er trust medicine.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: There's my exchange:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Throwing down a glove

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: what in the world he is

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That names me traitor, villain-like he lies:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Call by thy trumpet: he that dares approach,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: On him, on you, who not? I will maintain

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My truth and honour firmly.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: A herald, ho!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: A herald, ho, a herald!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Trust to thy single virtue; for thy soldiers,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: All levied in my name, have in my name

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Took their discharge.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: My sickness grows upon me.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: She is not well; convey her to  my tent.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exit Regan, led

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Enter a Herald

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Come hither, herald,--Let the trumpet sound,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: And read out this.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Sound, trumpet!

speaker: Captain
text_entry: A trumpet sounds

speaker: Herald
text_entry: [Reads]  'If any man of quality or degree within

speaker: Herald
text_entry: the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund,

speaker: Herald
text_entry: supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold

speaker: Herald
text_entry: traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the

speaker: Herald
text_entry: trumpet: he is bold in his defence.'

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Sound!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: First trumpet

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Again!

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Second trumpet

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Again!

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Third trumpet

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Trumpet answers within

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Enter EDGAR, at the third sound, armed, with a trumpet before him

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Ask him his purposes, why he appears

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Upon this call o' the trumpet.

speaker: Herald
text_entry: What are you?

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Your name, your quality? and why you answer

speaker: Herald
text_entry: This present summons?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Know, my name is lost;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: By treason's tooth bare-gnawn and canker-bit:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Yet am I noble as the adversary

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I come to cope.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Which is that adversary?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What's he that speaks for Edmund Earl of Gloucester?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Himself: what say'st thou to him?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Draw thy sword,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That, if my speech offend a noble heart,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy arm may do thee justice: here is mine.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: My oath, and my profession: I protest,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Maugre thy strength, youth, place, and eminence,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Despite thy victor sword and fire-new fortune,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy valour and thy heart, thou art a traitor;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Conspirant 'gainst this high-illustrious prince;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And, from the extremest upward of thy head

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To the descent and dust below thy foot,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: A most toad-spotted traitor. Say thou 'No,'

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: This sword, this arm, and my best spirits, are bent

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thou liest.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: In wisdom I should ask thy name;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: But, since thy outside looks so fair and warlike,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: What safe and nicely I might well delay

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: By rule of knighthood, I disdain and spurn:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Back do I toss these treasons to thy head;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: With the hell-hated lie o'erwhelm thy heart;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Which, for they yet glance by and scarcely bruise,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This sword of mine shall give them instant way,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Where they shall rest for ever. Trumpets, speak!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Alarums. They fight. EDMUND falls

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Save him, save him!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: This is practise, Gloucester:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By the law of arms thou wast not bound to answer

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: An unknown opposite; thou art not vanquish'd,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: But cozen'd and beguiled.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Shut your mouth, dame,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Or with this paper shall I stop it: Hold, sir:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Thou worse than any name, read thine own evil:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: No tearing, lady: I perceive you know it.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Gives the letter to EDMUND

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Say, if I do, the laws are mine, not thine:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Who can arraign me for't.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Most monstrous! oh!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Know'st thou this paper?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Ask me not what I know.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Go after her: she's desperate; govern her.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: What you have charged me with, that have I done;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And more, much more; the time will bring it out:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: 'Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I do forgive thee.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Let's exchange charity.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: If more, the more thou hast wrong'd me.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: My name is Edgar, and thy father's son.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Make instruments to plague us:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The dark and vicious place where thee he got

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Cost him his eyes.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Thou hast spoken right, 'tis true;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The wheel is come full circle: I am here.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Methought thy very gait did prophesy

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: A royal nobleness: I must embrace thee:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Let sorrow split my heart, if ever I

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Did hate thee or thy father!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Worthy prince, I know't.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Where have you hid yourself?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: How have you known the miseries of your father?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And when 'tis told, O, that my heart would burst!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The bloody proclamation to escape,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That follow'd me so near,--O, our lives' sweetness!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That we the pain of death would hourly die

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Rather than die at once!--taught me to shift

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Into a madman's rags; to assume a semblance

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That very dogs disdain'd: and in this habit

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Met I my father with his bleeding rings,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Their precious stones new lost: became his guide,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Led him, begg'd for him, saved him from despair;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Never,--O fault!--reveal'd myself unto him,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Until some half-hour past, when I was arm'd:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Not sure, though hoping, of this good success,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I ask'd his blessing, and from first to last

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Told him my pilgrimage: but his flaw'd heart,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Alack, too weak the conflict to support!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Burst smilingly.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This speech of yours hath moved me,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And shall perchance do good: but speak you on;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: You look as you had something more to say.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: If there be more, more woeful, hold it in;

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: For I am almost ready to dissolve,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Hearing of this.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: This would have seem'd a period

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To such as love not sorrow; but another,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To amplify too much, would make much more,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And top extremity.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Whilst I was big in clamour came there in a man,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who, having seen me in my worst estate,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Shunn'd my abhorr'd society; but then, finding

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who 'twas that so endured, with his strong arms

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He fastened on my neck, and bellow'd out

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: As he'ld burst heaven; threw him on my father;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That ever ear received: which in recounting

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: His grief grew puissant and the strings of life

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Began to crack: twice then the trumpets sounded,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And there I left him tranced.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: But who was this?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Kent, sir, the banish'd Kent; who in disguise

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Follow'd his enemy king, and did him service

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Improper for a slave.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter a Gentleman, with a bloody knife

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Help, help, O, help!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What kind of help?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Speak, man.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What means that bloody knife?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis hot, it smokes;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: It came even from the heart of--O, she's dead!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Who dead? speak, man.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Your lady, sir, your lady: and her sister

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: By her is poisoned; she hath confess'd it.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I was contracted to them both: all three

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Now marry in an instant.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Here comes Kent.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Produce their bodies, be they alive or dead:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Touches us not with pity.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exit Gentleman

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Enter KENT

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: O, is this he?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The time will not allow the compliment

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Which very manners urges.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I am come

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To bid my king and master aye good night:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Is he not here?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Great thing of us forgot!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Speak, Edmund, where's the king? and where's Cordelia?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: See'st thou this object, Kent?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The bodies of GONERIL and REGAN are brought in

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Alack, why thus?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Yet Edmund was beloved:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The one the other poison'd for my sake,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And after slew herself.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Even so. Cover their faces.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I pant for life: some good I mean to do,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Be brief in it, to the castle; for my writ

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Nay, send in time.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Run, run, O, run!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To who, my lord? Who hath the office? send

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy token of reprieve.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Well thought on: take my sword,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Give it the captain.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Haste thee, for thy life.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exit EDGAR

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: He hath commission from thy wife and me

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To hang Cordelia in the prison, and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To lay the blame upon her own despair,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That she fordid herself.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: EDMUND is borne off

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Re-enter KING LEAR, with CORDELIA dead in his arms; EDGAR, Captain, and others following

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Howl, howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Had I your tongues and eyes, I'ld use them so

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That heaven's vault should crack. She's gone for ever!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I know when one is dead, and when one lives;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: She's dead as earth. Lend me a looking-glass;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If that her breath will mist or stain the stone,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, then she lives.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Is this the promised end

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Or image of that horror?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Fall, and cease!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This feather stirs; she lives! if it be so,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That ever I have felt.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: [Kneeling]  O my good master!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Prithee, away.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: 'Tis noble Kent, your friend.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I might have saved her; now she's gone for ever!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Cordelia, Cordelia! stay a little. Ha!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What is't thou say'st? Her voice was ever soft,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I kill'd the slave that was a-hanging thee.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: 'Tis true, my lords, he did.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Did I not, fellow?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I would have made them skip: I am old now,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Mine eyes are not o' the best: I'll tell you straight.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If fortune brag of two she loved and hated,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: One of them we behold.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The same,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Your servant Kent: Where is your servant Caius?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: He's a good fellow, I can tell you that;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: He'll strike, and quickly too: he's dead and rotten.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: No, my good lord; I am the very man,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'll see that straight.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That, from your first of difference and decay,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Have follow'd your sad steps.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You are welcome hither.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Nor no man else: all's cheerless, dark, and deadly.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Your eldest daughters have fordone them selves,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And desperately are dead.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ay, so I think.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: He knows not what he says: and vain it is

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: That we present us to him.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Very bootless.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter a Captain

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Edmund is dead, my lord.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: That's but a trifle here.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: You lords and noble friends, know our intent.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: What comfort to this great decay may come

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Shall be applied: for us we will resign,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: During the life of this old majesty,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To him our absolute power:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To EDGAR and KENT

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: you, to your rights:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: With boot, and such addition as your honours

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Have more than merited. All friends shall taste

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The wages of their virtue, and all foes

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And my poor fool is hang'd! No, no, no life!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And thou no breath at all? Thou'lt come no more,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Never, never, never, never, never!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pray you, undo this button: thank you, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do you see this? Look on her, look, her lips,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Look there, look there!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dies

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He faints! My lord, my lord!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Break, heart; I prithee, break!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Look up, my lord.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Vex not his ghost: O, let him pass! he hates him much

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That would upon the rack of this tough world

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Stretch him out longer.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He is gone, indeed.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The wonder is, he hath endured so long:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: He but usurp'd his life.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Bear them from hence. Our present business

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Is general woe.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To KENT and EDGAR

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Friends of my soul, you twain

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My master calls me, I must not say no.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The weight of this sad time we must obey;

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The oldest hath borne most: we that are young

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Shall never see so much, nor live so long.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exeunt, with a dead march
